member.summary: Gets the minimum depth requirement stated in Sec 5.2.3 of EBCS-2-1995
member.param: The grade of steel to be used
The effective span in meter and for two way slabs it is the shorter span.
Is one of the types of span defined by the eTypeOfSpan enumeration

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eSteelGrade
member.summary: Specifies the available grades of steel based of EBCS

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eSteelGrade.S300
member.summary: Represents the grade of steel with characterstic strength of 300MPa

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eSteelGrade.S400
member.summary: Represents the grade of steel with characterstic strength of 400MPa

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eSteelGrade.S460
member.summary: Represents the grade of steel with characterstic strength of 460MPa

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.SteelDensity
member.summary: Density of Steel in kg/mm^3. [Sec. 2.8.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.SteelModOfElasticity
member.summary: Modulus of elasticity of steel in N/mm^2 [Sec.2.9.4.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.summary: Gets the characterstic cylinder compressive concrete strength [Sec. 2.3 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_f_ck(ESADS_Code.eConcreteGrade)
member.summary: Gets the characterstic compressive strength of concrete based on the grade and type of test specimen [Sec. 2.3 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_f_ctk(ESADS_Code.eConcreteGrade)
member.summary: Gets the characterstic concrete tensile strength[Sec. 2.4 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.summary: Gets the characterstic concrete tensile strength[Sec. 2.4 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.summary: Gets the characterstic steel strength

member.summary: Gets the modulus of elasticity of the selected material.
member.param: The grade of concrete
member.returns: The modulus of elasticity of concrete in MPa

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eMaterial.Get_ConcUnitWeight(ESADS_Code.eConcreteType)
member.summary: Gets the unit weight of concrete based on its type[Table 2.1 of EBCS-1-1995]
member.returns: The unit weight of the specified concrete in Kg/mm^3

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eConcreteGrade
member.summary: Used to specify different types of grade of concrete
member.remarks: Allowable Grades in ClassI I and ClassI II Work are different, therefore there must be FindDesnCompStrength condition to handle this. This enumertion totaly include the domains of bothe ClassI Works

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eTypeOfLimitState
member.summary: Holds the types of limit states

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eTypeOfLimitState.SLS
member.summary: serviceability limit state

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eTypeOfLimitState.ULS
member.summary: ultimate limit state

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eExposureType
member.summary: Enumerates the varies Enviromental exposure conditions for Deciding the minimum reinforcement Cover

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eExposureType.Mild
member.summary: Represents Exposures in Dry Enviroment: Interior of a building Normal Habituation office [EBCS _1995 7.1.3 Concrete Cover to Reinforcement,Table 7.2 Minimum Cover Requirements for Concrete Members]

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eExposureType.Moderate
member.summary: Represents Exposures in Humid environment:Interior components (e.g. laundries); exterior components;components in non-aggressive soil and/or in water[EBCS1995 Table 7.2 Minimum Cover Requirements for Concrete Members]

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eExposureType.Severe
member.summary: Represents Exposures Sever Enviromental Condition[EBCS1995 Table 7.2 Minimum Cover Requirements for Concrete Members]]

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eMaterialType
member.summary: Set of materials defined in the building code.

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eMaterialType.Concrete
member.summary: Is a material made from a mixture of aggregates and cement and moulded into a shape.

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eMaterialType.ReinforcingSteel
member.summary: Is the material composed into RC to impart tensile strength capacity for concrete

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eDesignSituation
member.summary: Those sets of physical conditions representing a certain time interval for which the design will demonstrate that relevant limit states are not exceeded. [Section 3.3.1 of EBCS -2, 1995], [Section 1.1.3.2 of EBCS-1, 1995]
member.remarks: See Section 3.3.1 of EBCS-2, 1995 See also Section 1.1.3.2 of EBCS -1, 1995 for definition

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eDesignSituation.Accidental
member.summary: Design situation involving exceptional conditions of the structure or its exposure, e.g. fire, explosion, impact or local failure. [Sec. 1.1.3.2 of EBCS-1, 1995]

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eDesignSituation.PersistentAndTransient
member.summary: Applying both persistent and transient conditions. Persistent means Design situation which is relevant during a period of the same order as the design working life of the structure. Generally it refers to conditions of normal use. [Sec 1.1.3.2 of EBCS -1, 1995]. Transient means Design situation which is relevant during a period much shorter that the design working life of the structure and which as a high probability of occurrence. It refers to temporary conditions of the structure, of use, or exposure, e.g. during construction or repair. [Sec 1.1.3.2 of EBCS-1, 1995].

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eTypeOfConcreteTestSpecimen
member.summary: Defines the types of test specimen to test the compressive strength of concrete.

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eTypeOfConcreteTestSpecimen.Cube
member.summary: 200mm sized cubical test specimen

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.eTypeOfConcreteTestSpecimen.Cylinder
member.summary: 150mm diameter and 300mm high cylinderical test specimen

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.eDesignCondition
member.summary: Is the condition of design, favourable or unfavourable

member.name: T:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign
member.summary: Contains the provisions given in Chapter 3, Basis of Design of EBCS-2, 1995

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.ε_c_max_bending
member.summary: Is the maximum compressive strain of concrete in bending(simple or compound) [Sec. 4.2.1.1 of EBCS-2-1995]

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.ε_s_max
member.summary: Is the maximum steel tensile strain.

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.ε_c_max_axial
member.summary: Is the maximum compressive strain of concrete in axial compression

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.GetMaterialPartialSafetyFactor(ESADS_Code.eMaterialType,ESADS_Code.eDesignSituation,ESADS_Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the ultimate limit state partial safety factors for the specified material based on the classwork and design situation.[Sec. 3.5.3.1 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The type of material defined in eMaterialType enumeration whose partial safety factor is to be determined.
The design situation defined in eDesignSituation enumeration in which the material is going to be used
The class of work defined in eClassWork enumeration that expresses the quality of work of the design.
member.returns: The ultimate limit state partial safety factor of the selected material.

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.GetMaterialPartialSafetyFactor(ESADS_Code.eTypeOfLimitState,ESADS_Code.eMaterialType,ESADS_Code.eDesignSituation,ESADS_Code.eClassWork)
member.summary: Gets the partial safety factors for the specified material based on the type of limit state, classwork and design situation.[Sec. 3.5.3 of EBCS-2-1995]
member.param: The type of design to be conducted with the safety factor returned.
The type of material defined in eMaterialType enumeration whose partial safety factor is to be determined.
The design situation defined in eDesignSituation enumeration in which the material is going to be used
The class of work defined in eClassWork enumeration that expresses the quality of work of the design.
member.returns: The partial safety factor of the selected material

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_cd(ESADS_Code.eConcreteGrade,ESADS_Code.eClassWork,ESADS_Code.eDesignSituation)
member.summary: Gets the compressive strength of concrete based on the class of work according to Sec. 3.5.4.1 if EBCS-2-1995
member.param: The grade of the concrete defined in eConcreteGrade enumeration
The class of the work defined in eClassWork enumeration
The design situation defined in eDesignSituation enumeration
member.returns: The design compressive strength of concrete

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eBasisOfDesign.Get_f_cd(ESADS_Code.eConcreteGrade,ESADS_Code.eClassWork)
member.param: The grade of concrete
The class of the work

member.summary: Gets the compressive strength of concrete [Sec. 3.5.4 of EBCS -2-1995]

member.name: F:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eFlexure.StressApprxFactor
member.summary: A coefficient to estimate the actual parabolic stress distribution with rectangular one.

member.summary: Gets the maximum x/d value[Sec. 3.7.9 of EBCS 2, 1995]
member.param: The moment after redistribution. For example 0.9 for 10% redistribution

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eFlexure.Get_k_x_max

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.Get_ρ_min(ESADS_Code.eTypeOfStructure,ESADS_Code.eSteelGrade)
member.summary: Gets the minimum geometrical ratio of reinforcement

member.name: M:ESADS_Code.EBCS_1995.eDetailing.GetMinSpacing(System.Double,System.Double)

The maximum aggregate size of the concrete used
